object_to_sort.name: Broken Bluetooth speaker
object_to_sort.mission: Your old Bluetooth speaker no longer turns on. How should you dispose of it?

answers.name: first
answers.value: Throw it in the household trash

answers.name: second
answers.value: Take it to an electronic waste collection point

answers.name: third
answers.value: Leave it outside for someone to take

object_to_sort.precision: Electronic devices contain batteries, metals, and plastics that must be recycled properly. Always bring them to an official e-waste collection point.

object_to_sort.name: Piles & batteries
object_to_sort.mission: You find a bag full of old batteries at home.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Bring them to a battery recycling box

answers.name: second
answers.value: Put them in the recycling bin

answers.name: third
answers.value: Throw them away with normal trash

object_to_sort.precision: Batteries contain toxic chemicals and can pollute water and soil. They must be placed in special battery recycling containers found in shops and supermarkets.

object_to_sort.name: Broken cables
object_to_sort.mission: You have a pile of broken phone and USB cables.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Burn them to recover copper

answers.name: second
answers.value: Throw them in the plastic bin

answers.name: third
answers.value: Recycle them with electronic waste

object_to_sort.precision: Cables contain valuable metals like copper. They must be treated in proper e-waste facilities to recover materials and reduce pollution.

object_to_sort.name: Old phone collection
object_to_sort.mission: Your parents want to get rid of some old phones.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Put them in the glass recycling bin

answers.name: second
answers.value: Donate them or recycle them at a collection point

answers.name: third
answers.value: Keep them forever in a drawer

object_to_sort.precision: Phones contain gold, copper, and rare earths that can be reused. Recycling or donating them avoids unnecessary extraction of new materials.

object_to_sort.name: Damaged USB keys
object_to_sort.mission: Your USB keys no longer work at all.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Dispose of them in electronic waste bins

answers.name: second
answers.value: Throw them in the paper recycling bin

answers.name: third
answers.value: Leave them somewhere in case someone fixes them

object_to_sort.precision: USB keys contain electronic circuits which must be processed with other small electronic waste, not in regular recycling bins.

object_to_sort.name: Old TV
object_to_sort.mission: You need to get rid of an old TV that no longer works.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Break it into pieces and throw it away

answers.name: second
answers.value: Put it on the sidewalk

answers.name: third
answers.value: Take it to a recycling center

object_to_sort.precision: TVs contain hazardous substances like lead and mercury. They must be processed in special facilities to avoid environmental contamination.

object_to_sort.name: Outdated smartwatch
object_to_sort.mission: Your smartwatch is broken and cannot be repaired.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Throw it in the compost because it's small

answers.name: second
answers.value: Recycle it with small electronics

answers.name: third
answers.value: Remove the strap and recycle it separately in plastic bins

object_to_sort.precision: Smartwatches contain batteries, sensors, and electronic circuits. They must be recycled with other small electronic devices.

object_to_sort.name: Ink cartridges
object_to_sort.mission: Your printer’s ink cartridges are empty.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Recycle them at a cartridge collection point

answers.name: second
answers.value: Throw them in the plastic recycling bin

answers.name: third
answers.value: Put them in the regular trash

object_to_sort.precision: Ink cartridges contain chemicals that must be handled carefully. Many shops provide special collection boxes for cartridges.

object_to_sort.name: Electronic waste box
object_to_sort.mission: You want to dispose of an old mouse, a keyboard, and broken headphones.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Throw them in the household trash

answers.name: second
answers.value: Take them to an electronic recycling point

answers.name: third
answers.value: Burn them in the garden to save space

object_to_sort.precision: Small electronic devices must be recycled at specialized collection points. They contain metals and chemicals that are harmful if thrown away improperly, but valuable if recycled correctly.

object_to_sort.name: Old smartphone charger
object_to_sort.mission: You found several old chargers at home, but you don’t know what to do with them.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Throw them in the normal trash

answers.name: second
answers.value: Bring them to an e-waste collection point

answers.name: third
answers.value: Keep them forever in a drawer

object_to_sort.precision: Old chargers contain copper, plastic and electronic components that can be recycled. Never throw them in regular trash: take them to a specialized electronic waste collection point.

object_to_sort.name: Forgotten devices
object_to_sort.mission: You find old phones and MP3 players in a box at home.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Leave them in the box for another 10 years

answers.name: second
answers.value: Throw the entire box in the trash

answers.name: third
answers.value: Recycle them properly at an e-waste point

object_to_sort.precision: Storing unused electronics contributes to hidden e-waste. Recycling recovers valuable materials like gold, copper, and rare metals, reducing mining and pollution.

object_to_repair.name: Keyboard not responding
object_to_repair.mission: Your laptop keyboard doesn't respond on certain keys.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Clean under the keys and check keyboard drivers

answers.name: second
answers.value: Replace the entire laptop

answers.name: third
answers.value: Smash the keyboard hoping it will fix it

object_to_repair.precision: Dirt or outdated drivers are often the cause. Cleaning or reinstalling drivers is cheaper and better for the environment.

object_to_repair.name: Battery draining fast
object_to_repair.mission: Your phone battery drains too quickly.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Buy the newest smartphone

answers.name: second
answers.value: Replace the battery

answers.name: third
answers.value: Use the phone only while plugged in

object_to_repair.precision: Replacing the battery is one of the simplest and most effective ways to extend the life of a smartphone. Have it done at a specialist shop.

object_to_repair.name: Noisy laptop fan
object_to_repair.mission: Your laptop is extremely noisy even during light use.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Stop using it completely

answers.name: second
answers.value: Clean the fans and vents

answers.name: third
answers.value: Cover the laptop to muffle the noise

object_to_repair.precision: Dust buildup is a major cause of noise and overheating. Cleaning extends the laptop's lifespan and improves performance.The website https://fr.ifixit.com/ provides access to excellent tutorials on methods and best practices for repairing electronic devices.

object_to_repair.name: Cracked smartphone screen
object_to_repair.mission: Your smartphone screen is cracked but still usable.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Replace the screen

answers.name: second
answers.value: Buy a new phone immediately

answers.name: third
answers.value: Ignore the cracks until it stops working

object_to_repair.precision: A screen replacement is cheaper and avoids unnecessary waste. Most phones can be repaired easily using guides. The website https://fr.ifixit.com/ provides access to excellent tutorials on methods and best practices for repairing electronic devices. Or have it done at a specialist shop.

object_to_repair.name: Old computer running slow
object_to_repair.mission: Your computer is getting slow after years of use.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Throw it away

answers.name: second
answers.value: Add RAM or switch to an SSD

answers.name: third
answers.value: Install 50 performance-boosting apps

object_to_repair.precision: Upgrading RAM or moving to a solid-state drive dramatically improves performance and extends lifespan.

object_to_repair.name: Faulty headphone jack
object_to_repair.mission: Your laptop’s headphone jack sometimes disconnects.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Stop listening to audio entirely

answers.name: second
answers.value: Replace the entire laptop

answers.name: third
answers.value: Use a USB sound card or Bluetooth adapter

object_to_repair.precision: USB or Bluetooth adapters are cheap, effective, and avoid having to replace a fully functional machine.

object_to_repair.name: PC overheating
object_to_repair.mission: Your computer gets extremely hot during gaming or video editing.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Replace the thermal paste and clean the fans

answers.name: second
answers.value: Place ice packs on the PC

answers.name: third
answers.value: Buy a brand new gaming PC

object_to_repair.precision: Thermal paste wears out after several years. Replacing it improves cooling efficiency and prevents hardware damage. The website https://fr.ifixit.com/ provides access to excellent tutorials on methods and best practices for repairing electronic devices.

object_to_repair.name: Broken laptop hinge
object_to_repair.mission: The hinge on your laptop is cracked and difficult to open.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Force it open every time

answers.name: second
answers.value: Repair or replace the hinge

answers.name: third
answers.value: Buy a new laptop

object_to_repair.precision: A hinge is a mechanical part that can be easily replaced. Replacing it avoids premature disposal of a fully working device. The website https://fr.ifixit.com/ provides access to excellent tutorials on methods and best practices for repairing electronic devices.

object_to_repair.name: Batteries dead
object_to_repair.mission: This computer is just two years old and still performs well for its previous use.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Change the batteries

answers.name: second
answers.value: Buy a new PC

answers.name: third
answers.value: Eat it

object_to_repair.precision: Replacing the battery is the best possible solution, especially if the computer is still usable. Replacing the battery is a relatively simple task. The website https://fr.ifixit.com/ provides access to excellent tutorials on methods and best practices for repairing electronic devices.

object_to_repair.name: Lack of storage
object_to_repair.mission: This computer is just two years old and still performs well for its previous use.It just needs a little more space.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Purchase cloud space

answers.name: second
answers.value: Purchase and add new disks

answers.name: third
answers.value: Purchase a new PC

object_to_repair.precision: Buying cloud storage may seem more attractive in the short term, but it ends up costing more for you and the planet. Buying a new computer is not at all attractive from any perspective. The best solution is still to buy a hard drive, which can be internal or external (USB).

object_to_repair.name: Slow smartphone
object_to_repair.mission: Your phone is getting slow, but physically it works perfectly. What should you do?

answers.name: first
answers.value: Use two phones: one for apps, one for calls

answers.name: second
answers.value: Buy the newest smartphone on the market

answers.name: third
answers.value: Clean unused apps and perform a factory reset

object_to_repair.precision: Before replacing a phone, always try software cleaning. Removing apps, clearing cache, or doing a factory reset often restores performance. Buying a new phone generates unnecessary CO₂ and e-waste.

object_to_repair.name: Broken laptop screen
object_to_repair.mission: Your laptop screen is cracked after a fall, but everything else works fine.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Throw it away and use a friend's computer

answers.name: second
answers.value: Buy a new laptop

answers.name: third
answers.value: Replace only the screen

object_to_repair.precision: Most laptop screens can be replaced for a low cost and greatly extend the device's lifespan. Throwing away or replacing the entire laptop would create avoidable electronic waste. The website https://fr.ifixit.com/ provides access to excellent tutorials on methods and best practices for repairing electronic devices.

object_to_repair.name: Old but functional PC
object_to_repair.mission: You have a 7-year-old PC that still works, but struggles with modern applications.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Install a lightweight operating system (Linux, etc.)

answers.name: second
answers.value: Send it to recycling immediately

answers.name: third
answers.value: Buy a new PC

object_to_repair.precision: Older computers can gain several extra years of life by installing lighter systems like Linux Mint, Xubuntu, or ChromeOS Flex. Recycling should come only when useful upgrades are no longer possible.

object_to_repair.name: Overheating PC
object_to_repair.mission: Your computer often overheats and slows down when you use it.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Place the PC in the fridge to cool it down

answers.name: second
answers.value: Clean the fans and replace the thermal paste

answers.name: third
answers.value: Buy a more powerful PC

object_to_repair.precision: Dust and old thermal paste are the most common causes of overheating. Cleaning the fans or applying new thermal paste drastically improves performance and extends lifespan without generating waste.The website https://fr.ifixit.com/ provides access to excellent tutorials on methods and best practices for repairing electronic devices.

object_to_repair.name: Wi-Fi problems
object_to_repair.mission: Your computer can’t connect properly to Wi-Fi, but works great otherwise.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Buy a new computer with better Wi-Fi

answers.name: second
answers.value: Buy a USB Wi-Fi adapter

answers.name: third
answers.value: Use mobile data permanently

object_to_repair.precision: USB Wi-Fi adapters are inexpensive and extend the life of many computers. Replacing the entire machine would be wasteful and create unnecessary environmental impact.

object_to_repair.name: Slow school computer
object_to_repair.mission: Your school computer is slow, but the IT department says hardware replacement isn’t planned.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Abandon the PC and only use your smartphone

answers.name: second
answers.value: Complain loudly until they buy new PCs

answers.name: third
answers.value: Install a lightweight browser and disable unnecessary extensions

object_to_repair.precision: Optimizing software, removing unnecessary extensions, and using lightweight tools greatly improves performance without requiring new hardware. This helps extend the life of shared school computers.

object_to_repair.name: Printer not working
object_to_repair.mission: Your printer refuses to print, even though it turns on normally.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Check drivers and clean the print heads

answers.name: second
answers.value: Throw it away immediately

answers.name: third
answers.value: Buy a brand new printer

object_to_repair.precision: Most printer failures come from clogged print heads or outdated drivers. Cleaning or updating them is often enough to fix the issue without replacing the printer.The website https://fr.ifixit.com/ provides access to excellent tutorials on methods and best practices for repairing electronic devices.

object_to_repair.name: Second-hand opportunity
object_to_repair.mission: You need a laptop for basic tasks (documents, emails, streaming).

answers.name: first
answers.value: Buy the latest high-end model

answers.name: second
answers.value: Buy a refurbished laptop

answers.name: third
answers.value: Use an old computer from a friend without checking its condition

object_to_repair.precision: Refurbished devices reduce environmental impact and provide excellent quality at lower cost. Buying a high-end machine for basic tasks wastes resources unnecessarily.

object_to_repair.name: Electronic toys
object_to_repair.mission: Your younger sister’s old electronic toys no longer turn on.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Buy entirely new toys

answers.name: second
answers.value: Throw them away

answers.name: third
answers.value: Try replacing the batteries

object_to_repair.precision: Most battery-powered toys simply need fresh batteries. Repairing or maintaining them avoids unnecessary waste and allows them to be reused or donated.

object_to_repair.name: Dusty desktop PC
object_to_repair.mission: A desktop PC is very loud and seems to struggle even with simple tasks.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Open it and remove dust from fans and vents

answers.name: second
answers.value: Throw it out because it’s too old

answers.name: third
answers.value: Install random softwares to 'boost' it

object_to_repair.precision: Dust buildup drastically slows computers and increases noise. Cleaning inside the case often restores performance. Avoid 'boost' softwares: they rarely help and often harm performance. The website https://fr.ifixit.com/ provides access to excellent tutorials on methods and best practices for repairing electronic devices.

object_to_repair.name: Broken HDMI port
object_to_repair.mission: Your laptop’s HDMI port is broken and you can't connect it to a screen.

answers.name: first
answers.value: Use a USB-C or USB adapter as an alternative

answers.name: second
answers.value: Replace the entire laptop

answers.name: third
answers.value: Stop using an external monitor forever

object_to_repair.precision: Most laptops offer multiple connection options (USB-C, DisplayPort adapters, docking stations). Adapters cost little and avoid replacing a functional laptop.
